00019 #option parsing
00020 #TODO optparse is depreceated since 2.7
00021 #switch to argparse (NOT supported in 2.6)
00022 
00023 from optparse import OptionParser
00024 import math #needed for NaN checks
00025 
00026 usage = "usage: %prog [options] conf1 conf2"
00027 parser = OptionParser(usage=usage)
00028 parser.add_option("--eps", dest="eps", metavar="EPS",
00029                   help="tolerance for mismatch", default=1e-5)
00030 (options, args) = parser.parse_args()                  
00031 
00032 eps = float(options.eps)
00033 
00034 def die(str):
00035   print str
00036   quit(1)
00037 
00038 
00039 def difference_relative(v1, v2, _eps):
00040   """calculates relative difference - see table_combine.pl for original version"""
00041   """this is just a translation of the perl function"""
00042   v1 = float(v1)
00043   v2 = float(v2)
00044   if math.isnan(v1): v1 = 0
00045   if math.isnan(v2): v2 = 0
00046   if v1 == v2: return 0
00047   if abs(v1-v2) < _eps: return abs(v1-v2)
00048   if abs(v1) > abs(v2): return abs(v1-v2)/abs(v1)
00049   return abs(v1-v2)/abs(v2)
00050 
00051 if len(args) != 2:
00052   die("two data files required as parameters")
00053 
00054 #open both files
00055 try: 
00056   dataf1 = open(args[0])
00057   dataf2 = open(args[1])
00058 except:
00059   die("error while opening files")
00060 
00061 data1 = dataf1.readlines()
00062 data2 = dataf2.readlines()
00063 #loop through files
00064 for i in range(len(data1)):
00065   #TODO: skip comment lines?
00066   #if ^[@#]: continue
00067 
00068   vals1 = data1[i].split()
00069   vals2 = data2[i].split()
00070   
00071   #number of cols equal?
00072   if len(vals1) != len(vals2): die("Number of columns different")
00073   
00074   #compare all cols with tolerance
00075   for j in range(0,len(vals1)):
00076     #if abs(float(vals1[j]) - float(vals2[j])) > options.eps: 
00077     diff=difference_relative(vals1[j], vals2[j], eps)
00078     if diff > eps: 
00079       die("mismatch in line %d col %d, %s != %s" %(i+1,j+1,vals1[j],vals2[j]))
